info.title: Purplship API
info.description:
## API Reference

Purplship is an open source multi-carrier shipping API that simplifies the integration of logistic carrier services.

The Purplship API is organized around REST. Our API has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts JSON-encoded 
request bodies, returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs.

The Purplship API differs for every account as we release new versions.
These docs are customized to your version of the API.


## Versioning

When backwards-incompatible changes are made to the API, a new, dated version is released. 
The current version is `2021.6rc3`. 

Read our API changelog and to learn more about backwards compatibility.

As a precaution, use API versioning to check a new API version before committing to an upgrade.


## Pagination

All top-level API resources have support for bulk fetches via "list" API methods. For instance, you can list addresses, 
list shipments, and list trackers. These list API methods share a common structure, taking at least these 
two parameters: limit, and offset.

Purplship utilizes offset-based pagination via the offset and limit parameters.
Both parameters take a number as value (see below) and return objects in reverse chronological order. 
The offset parameter returns objects listed after an index. 
The limit parameter take a limit on the number of objects to be returned from 1 to 100.


```json
{
    "next": "/v1/shipments?limit=25&offset=50",
    "previous": "/v1/shipments?limit=25&offset=25",
    "results": [
    ]
}
```

## Environments

The Purplship API offer the possibility to create and retrieve certain objects in `test_mode`.
In development, it is therefore possible to add carrier connections, get live rates, 
buy labels, create trackers and schedule pickups in `test_mode`.

Token.name: Authorization
Token.description:
API keys are used to authenticate requests. You can view and manage your API keys in the Dashboard.

Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your secret 
API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth.

Authentication to the API is performed via HTTP Bearer Auth. You do not need to provide a password.
To authenticate via bearer auth (e.g., for a cross-origin request), 
use `-H "Authorization: Token 19707922d97cef7a5d5e17c331ceeff66f226660"`.

API requests without authentication will also fail.

post.description: Authenticate the user and return a token pair
Authenticate the user and return a token pair
Verify an existent authentication token

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Create a new address.

x-code-samples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url /v1/addresses \
  --header 'Authorization: Token <API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
    "address_line1": "125 Church St",
    "person_name": "John Doe",
    "company_name": "A corp.",
    "phone_number": "+1 514 000 0000",
    "city": "Moncton",
    "country_code": "CA",
    "postal_code": "E1C4Z8",
    "residential": false,
    "state_code": "NB"
}'

get.description: Returns the list of configured carriers

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: carrier_name
parameters.description: Indicates a carrier (type)

parameters.name: test
parameters.description: This flag filter out carriers in test or prod mode

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: This flag indicates whether to return active carriers only

parameters.name: system_only
parameters.description: This flag indicates that only system carriers should be returned

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.description: Create a new parcel.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Schedule a pickup for one or many shipments with labels already purchased.

parameters.name: test
parameters.description: The test flag indicates whether to use a carrier configured for test.

x-code-samples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url /v1/pickups/<PICKUP_ID> \
  --header 'Authorization: Token <API_KEY>' \
  --data '{
    "pickup_date": "2020-10-25",
    "address": {
      "address_line1": "125 Church St",
      "person_name": "John Doe",
      "city": "Moncton",
      "country_code": "CA",
      "postal_code": "E1C4Z8",
      "state_code": "NB",
    },
    "ready_time": "13:00",
    "closing_time": "17:00",
    "instruction": "Should not be folded",
    "package_location": "At the main entrance hall",
    "tracking_numbers": [
        "8545763607864201002"
    ]
}'

patch.description: Modify a pickup for one or many shipments with labels already purchased.

post.description:
The Shipping process begins by fetching rates for your shipment.
Use this service to fetch a shipping rates available.

Once the shipping rates are retrieved, provide the required info to
submit the shipment by specifying your preferred rate.
Cancel a shipment and the label previously created

parameters.description: The test flag indicates whether to use a carrier configured for test.

post.description: Create a new shipment instance.

parameters.name: test
parameters.description: Create shipment in test or prod mode

delete.description: Void a shipment with the associated label.

post.description: Add the customs declaration for the shipment if non existent.

Add one or many options to your shipment.
**eg:**
- add shipment **insurance** - specify the preferred transaction **currency** - setup a **cash collected on delivery** option ```json { "insurance": 120, "currency": "USD" } ``` And many more, check additional options available in the [reference](#operation/all_references).
Add a parcel to an existing shipment for a multi-parcel shipment.
Select your preferred rates to buy a shipment label.

org_id.title: Org id
org_id.description:
**should be specified only in a multi-org deployment.**

Note the first org related to the user is selected by default.

packaging_type.title: Packaging type
packaging_type.description:
The parcel's packaging type. **Note that the packaging is optional when using a package preset** values:
- **envelope**
- **pak**
- **tube**
- **pallet**
- **small_box**
- **medium_box**
- **your_packaging** For specific carriers packaging type, please consult [the reference](#operation/references).

package_preset.title: Package preset
package_preset.description:
The parcel's package preset.

For specific carriers package preset, please consult [the reference](#operation/references).

is_document.title: Is document
is_document.description: Indicates if the parcel is composed of documents only

services.description:
The requested carrier service for the shipment.
Please consult [the reference](#operation/references) for specific carriers services. Note that this is a list because on a Multi-carrier rate request you could specify a service per carrier.

options.title: Options
options.description:
The options available for the shipment.

Please consult [the reference](#operation/references) for additional specific carriers options.

carrier_ids.description: The list of configured carriers you wish to get rates from.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The rate monetary values currency code

discount.title: Discount
discount.description: The monetary amount of the discount on the rate

base_charge.title: Base charge
base_charge.description:
The rate's monetary amount of the base charge.
This is the net amount of the rate before additional charges

total_charge.title: Total charge
total_charge.description:
The rate's monetary amount of the total charge.
This is the gross amount of the rate after adding the additional charges

duties_and_taxes.title: Duties and taxes
duties_and_taxes.description: The monetary amount of the duties and taxes if applied

extra_charges.description: list of the rate's additional charges
